IPM Cosmic Magnetism Group (CMG)

Origins, evolution, and effects of the cosmic magnetic field on structure formation in the universe are among pressing questions in astrophysics and cosmology. School of Astronomy (SoA) at Institute of Research in Fundamental Sciences (IPM) hosts researchers who are actively involved in both observational and theoretical studies of cosmic magnetism on various scales. For a better understanding of the subject it is very insightful to connect theoreticians with observers. The Cosmic Magnetism Group (CMG) is hence created to define collaborative projects.

Cosmic Magnetism Group Meeting (CMGM) is the monthly meetings of the CMG to

1- define and progress collaborative projects

2- present the latest findings in the field through journal clubs and free discussions

3- host talks from famous external and international scientists in the field

Meetings:

CMGMs are held (either in-person or hybrid) on Sundays, typically on the first Sunday of each month, at around 10 A.M. (GMT+03:30) Iran Time in the SoA Seminar Room. (Location)

If you would like to attend virtually or in person, please get in touch with the organizers.
